content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Below is a simple implementation of the `extract_julia_code` function in Julia using regular expressions:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks
    blocks = matchall(r"```julia\n(.*?)```", md, flags=re"")
    
    # Remove code fences and join the code blocks together with a newline
    code = reduce((a, b)->a*"\n"*b, blocks)
    
    return code
end
```

You can use this function to extract all Julia code from your markdown document.

Note: This function assumes that the code blocks in the markdown document are correctly formatted as ```julia\n(code)\n```. If there is any variation, this function will not work correctly.
